bibl.title: Tapia's Banquet Hall and Eulogios' Cell: Transfer of Ownership as a Security in Some Late Byzantine Papyri.
bibl.note: Started as a short presentation delivered in December 2006 in Vienna at a symposium to honour Peter E. Pieler's sixty-fifth birthday. - 1. Introduction: securing a loan in the late Byzantine papyri. - 2. Eulogios' cell [P. Dublin 32-34]. - 3. Tapia's banquet hall and other 'fictitious' sales in the archive of Kako and Patermouthis. - 4. Conclusions: purple-merchant's wife and sister-in-law. - Pp. 170-171: Postilla.

bibl.title: New Frontiers. Law and Society in the Roman World.

bibl.seg: Jakub Urbanik, Tapia's Banquet Hall and Eulogios' Cell: Transfer of Ownership as a Security in Some Late Byzantine Papyri.
Paul J. du Plessis (ed.), New Frontiers. Law and Society in the Roman World (Edinburgh, 2013) pp. 151-174, 2 arbres généal.

Started as a short presentation delivered in December 2006 in Vienna at a symposium to honour Peter E. Pieler's sixty-fifth birthday. - 1. Introduction: securing a loan in the late Byzantine papyri. - 2. Eulogios' cell [P. Dublin 32-34]. - 3. Tapia's banquet hall and other 'fictitious' sales in the archive of Kako and Patermouthis. - 4. Conclusions: purple-merchant's wife and sister-in-law. - Pp. 170-171: Postilla.
